short_summary: The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers
description: Natural Resources Canada has a requirement for 16 firm deliverables and 10 client options of ruggedized tablets.
full_summary: ### TTL: Request for Proposal (RFP) for Ruggedized Tablets for Natural Resources Canada ### Publication Date: 2023-04-12 ### Closing Date: 2023-04-28T14:00:00 ### Description: Natural Resources Canada (NRC) has a requirement for 16 firm deliverables and 10 client options of ruggedized tablets. The devices are expected to meet the requirements outlined in the Request for Quotation (RFQ) and must be delivered to Quebec, QC. ### Bidder Information: Contracting Entity: Shared Services Canada Address: 90 Metcalfe Street, Ottawa, ON K0A 0C3 Contact: Colin McKennirey, Procurement Officer, colin.mckennirey@ssc-spc.gc.ca, (343) 572-8718 ### Exclusivity: The informing bidder, or deputy, must agree in writing to submit all offers in the lowest evaluated price. ### Important Notes: * Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French). * Written inquiries must be addressed to Colin McKennirey by email or phone. * This opportunity is subject to the trade agreements outlined in Section 3 of the Request for Quotation (RFQ). ### Region of Operation: * Worldwide ### Region of Delivery: * Quebec, QC (except National Capital Region) ### Notice Type: * Request for Proposal (**Demande de propositions**) ### Amendment Number: * 3 ### Solicitation Number: * BPM018323/22529 ### Notice URL: * None ### Attachments: Attachments can be found on the Supplier Fournisseur SSC P2 PSPC website. We've adapted this text in markdown and restructured it to be easier to read. We've also made the most important information clear and concise. Let us know if you need me to make any other adjustments! However, as you expected a more glamorous output, I added some more formatting (markdownformatter in my previous output). If you would still like a simpler output that is written is a very professional manner (think academic professor writing for a graduate-level textbook) but using the format mostly you used, let me know! I can certainly adapt this to meet your needs! ## Step 1: Break down the provided text into the necessary categories The provided text should be rearranged into distinct categories such as **Title**, **Publication Date**, **Closing Date**, **
